column2: We have capped the number of points that players can earn from a repeatable achievement at 100. We realize that this cap implementation may have changed your achievement point totals, but it was necessary to support an upcoming reward structure for achievement points. We've attached a bonus reward to help make up for some of your time spent gaining these additional achievement points. Thanks for playing Guild Wars 2!
Fire a harpoon that cripples your foe.
This action may not be undone. You will permanently lose all the items and/or currency attached to this message.

It's not easy rearing devourers out here in the wild, but you make it look about as hard as taking a nap. We're ahead of our quota for once. Thanks for your help.

—Braxa Scalehunter
Double-click to unpack a full set of level 5 armor.

Heading into the Jungle?
Make Sure You're Prepared!
Wanted for theft, attempted murder, and incorrect filing of Patent Form 12.21-D. Recently sighted by a kodan patrol entering dredge-filled caverns, though she could be anywhere in the area by now.
Wanted for theft and vandalism of books as well as nonpayment of fines. Last seen fleeing south down snow-covered slopes from a library, though by now, snowshoes may no longer be required.

Wanted for fraud, thievery, and fencing stolen property. Last seen in a snow-top steading, attempting to sell the secrets of dwarven defensive strategies. Beware: target could be anywhere in the area.
Wanted for impersonating a deputy of the Lionguard. Reportedly hassling travelers on local roads, she was last spotted near Drifts detour. Target is restless; a wide search pattern may be necessary.
The rogue shaman Arderus is sought for his potential usefulness as an intelligence asset. Last sighted near the burning forest, though he could have moved on by now. Target has many area allies.
Wanted for questioning in attacks on charr merchants serving Ebonhawke peace delegations. Target will likely stay close to her Separatist allies but could still turn up someplace unexpected.
Wanted in connection with several property-damage suits. Last seen behaving aggressively at Meatoberfest. This Separatist keeps clear of Flame Legion territory but could be anywhere else in area.
This self-styled master of disguise is wanted for intelligence debriefing. Steeleye Span reports out-of-place creatures near area forts. Target seems to have sense enough to avoid the Brand.
This fugitive escaped from Scourgejaw's Vault, an Iron Legion prison quarry. Target has thus far proven expert at evading local authorities. You'll need to cast a wide net for this one.
Wanted for illegally attempting to keep a bear as a pet. Last seen fleeing from a centaur encampment into the sanctuary of other skritt, though target and bear associate may have moved on by now.
Wanted in connection with multiple harassment and public-nuisance complaints. Last seen pestering tengu merchants at their trading post, though target may have moved elsewhere in the region.
Wanted for illegal trafficking of exotic wildlife and attempting to wrangle karka in their native habitat. Target is a proficient explorer and could be anywhere on the island.

An experimental device has enraged various creatures around Fionnghuala Scratch in Timberline Falls. Defend the skritt sentries stationed outside the scratch until the researchers can shut down the device.
Brand energies coursing through crystal nodes along Blightwater Basin in Blazeridege Steppes are reaching critical levels. Work together to destroy these crystal nodes and stop the energy buildup.
Supply Master Sootspitter needs your help defending Iron Legion supplies bound for the front lines in Iron Marches. Help shore up his supply depot's defenses and repel any Flame Legion attacks.
Find and bring down a Branded ogre chieftain and his pet siege devourers in Varim's Run in the Fields of Ruin.
Krait have taken quaggans captive for ritual sacrifice in the Mire Sea in the Mount Maelstrom region. Rescue the captive quaggans before the krait execute them.
Rush the catwalks of Dostoev Sky Peak in Dredgehaunt Cliffs.
Rush the depths of Posternus Caverns in Lornar's Pass.
Rush through Flameroot Caverns in the Fields of Ruin.
Rush through Spider Nest Cavern in Diessa Plateau.
Rush through Bonerattler Caverns in the Harathi Hinterlands.
Rush across Driftglass Springs in Southsun Cove.

Kill Sons of Svanir, and tear down their territory markers and Dragon totems.
Build snowmen, stop troublemakers, and keep the lodge cozy and safe.

Salutations,

Dry Top's arid terrain is unknown to many. Your successful charting of the area speaks to your outstanding abilities and grit. Facing sandstorms, quicksand, and dust mites is a harrowing prospect, but you've braved them all.

We eagerly await news of your future exploits.

—Tyrian Explorers Society

Hi! I have good news and bad news. I'd ask which you want first, but—you know—it's mail. So, I choose good news first. As you may have noticed, my W.R.D. (waypoint recalibration device) worked like a champion! I've been monitoring the waypoint network, and as the workers repair the waypoints, the vines aren't attacking again. So...did I mention I'm a genius?

Now for the bad news. It's Phlunt. No surprise there, huh? He INSISTS that I give him a personal demonstration of how the W.R.D. works. It's as if he doesn't believe that my device is actually causing the change. I'm afraid he's going to try to weasel out of coming to the summit. Can you come be my backup? We may have to beat him up or something.

—Taimi

Dear %str1%,

I hope this finds you well. 

I'm afraid my efforts to get the queen to the summit haven't gone as smoothly as expected. The queen has had a situation arise that may prevent her from attending. I'll give you the full details when you arrive, but the short version is that someone is spreading rumors that Queen Jennah not only met with evil Scarlet prior to the Queen's Jubilee celebration, but also conspired to give Scarlet the mechanical watchknights. This is, of course, ridiculous. But the queen can't leave Divinity's Reach until these rumors are squelched. 

Countess Anise has suggested that I use my intuitive ability to find the cad spreading the rumors and discredit them. But, I don't want to do this alone. Will you come help me? 

Your friend,
—Kasmeer
Help Agent Kaukiri trick the dredge into fighting steam creatures.

Salutations,

Southsun Cove may be an island of rare natural wonders, but its unique fauna has proven challenging to explorer and settler alike. We salute your courage and willingness to venture into such an inhospitable territory.

Keep up the good work.

—Tyrian Explorers Society

The Inquest keeps interfering with your krewe's MIG project, so it's time to turn the tables and mess with them. Their Funhouse lab may have the equipment and information you need to help extract Doxa from the MIG, so you're going to break in and acquire it.
You've successfully deceived the dredge. Good job!

Double-click to gain a Hylek Blowgun. There and wood and poisons here, plenty enough to make weapons to defend our land and fight the undead."
—Qoetl"
Spawns a banquet table, keg and various other party items which players can eat and drink from. Lasts 1 hour.

Spawns a guild banner that will give +15%% karma, +15%% magic find, +15%% experience from kills, +15%% gold from kills, +15%% increased movement speed, and +15%% gathering chance to any ally that touches it for 30 minutes. Does not stack with other banner boosts.
Spawns a guild banner that will give +15%% gathering chance and 10%% movement speed boost for 30 minutes to any ally who touches it. Does not stack with other gathering or speed banners.
Spawns a guild banner that will give +10%% boost to gold from kills and +15%% boost to magic find for 30 minutes to any ally who touches it. Does not stack with other gold or magic find banners.
Spawns a guild banner that will give +10%% karma and +10%% experience from kills boost for 30 minutes to any ally who touches it. Does not stack with other karma or experience banners.
Transform into your guild's banner for 15 minutes or until hit. You cannot move while transformed.

Ascalonian Catacombs
Story recommended level: <c=#CC9900>30</c>
Explorable recommended level: <c=#CC9900>35</c>
The number of times you hit an enemy with a cannon shot.

%str1%,

Let me tell you, those skritt won't be the same—ever. We laughed so hard after you left, reminiscing about the special moments you shared with the skritt. And, trust me when I say, we don't have much cause for laughing out here.

Glad you came by and lifted our spirits.

—Sentinel Faithspotter

%str1%,

Nice work dispatching those Inquest. You'd think a group with so many geniuses" would know better than to build a facility so close to the Brand. Hopefully, you taught them something.

Dear %str1%,
Thanks to you for helping my brothers and sisters. Your efforts will allow our village to continue to grow and prosper, and remain at peace. You are a friend to all ogres of Degun Shun. — Shelp
Shoot a burst of energy at your foe.
Detonate the golem arm to cause an electrical surge, dazing and damaging nearby foes.
Shoot out a bolt of energy at your target and extracts their essence. 10%% chance to cause stun.
Sprays your target with essence dust and dazes them.
Destroys your weapon and causes increased damage to the foes near you.
Shoot an orb of energy at your target.
You are invisible. Invisibility is lost if you attack or lose your weapon.
Reverse-engineered plans for what appears to be complete gibberish. Whatever it is, it looks really dangerous. Might be kinda fun.
How thoughtful! What could it be?
